title: How to Make a Secret Storage Place from a Tissue Box

steps.headline: Pick a tissue box according to the size of the items you are trying to store.
steps.description: If you are trying to store big items, they will not fit in a small box.

steps.headline: Remove the plastic cover.
steps.description: When you try to insert items into the tissue box, they will not fit, that is why it is important to remove that layer.

steps.headline: Take the top off the box.
steps.description: Using scissors, start  in the middle and cut to the edge of the box. From there, cut around the box to remove the top layer of cardboard off the box.

steps.headline: Add construction paper, wrapping paper, or printer paper to the out side of the box.
steps.description: To give it color, cover it if you do not like the design on the box.

steps.headline: Store your items.
steps.description: You are ready to store things––just add the items and you are done!

steps.headline: Complete steps of Method 1's Basic Box.
steps.description: This will form the base of the box.

steps.headline: Take strips of cardboard, and assemble them in the manner you'd like, inside of the box.
steps.description: Use these as dividers, to allow you to store more things and keep them separate.

steps.headline: If wished, decorate the box.
steps.description: See Method 1 for ideas. Then the box is ready for storing your items.

steps.headline: Complete steps of Method 1's Basic Box.
steps.description: Follow steps 1 to 4 of the basic box. This will form the base of the box.

steps.headline: Take scissors and cut a side of your choosing on both sides.
steps.description: Cut along the sides to make a flap. Push down until it can hold on its own.

steps.headline: Add items.
steps.description: Now you are done with making your secret storage box. Store the items of your choosing.

steps.headline: Take all of the tissues out.
steps.description: You may throw all of the tissues away but 3 or 4.

steps.headline: Put whatever you want to hide inside the box
Layer the extra tissues over the things inside.
Pull one out halfway like you would normally see in a tissue box.
There you––a completely secret storing place right out in the open!
steps.description: Be aware that someone might want to use the tissue and if they do, they'll discover the storage items.

text: Basic Box Pick a tissue box according to the size of the items you are trying to store. If you are trying to store big items, they will not fit in a small box. Remove the plastic cover. When you try to insert items into the tissue box, they will not fit, that is why it is important to remove that layer. Take the top off the box. Using scissors, start  in the middle and cut to the edge of the box. From there, cut around the box to remove the top layer of cardboard off the box. Add construction paper, wrapping paper, or printer paper to the out side of the box. To give it color, cover it if you do not like the design on the box. Store your items. You are ready to store things––just add the items and you are done! Divided Box Complete steps of Method 1's Basic Box. This will form the base of the box. Take strips of cardboard, and assemble them in the manner you'd like, inside of the box. Use these as dividers, to allow you to store more things and keep them separate. If wished, decorate the box. See Method 1 for ideas. Then the box is ready for storing your items. Open Box Complete steps of Method 1's Basic Box. Follow steps 1 to 4 of the basic box. This will form the base of the box. Take scissors and cut a side of your choosing on both sides. Cut along the sides to make a flap. Push down until it can hold on its own. Add items. Now you are done with making your secret storage box. Store the items of your choosing. Secret Hiding Place Box Take all of the tissues out. You may throw all of the tissues away but 3 or 4. Put whatever you want to hide inside the box  Layer the extra tissues over the things inside.  Pull one out halfway like you would normally see in a tissue box.  There you––a completely secret storing place right out in the open! Be aware that someone might want to use the tissue and if they do, they'll discover the storage items.
